queries.normalized_query: create temporary table tmp_aggregates as select user_id, date(created_at) as date, count(*) as event_count from events where created_at > now() - interval ? group by user_id, date(created_at);
delete from audit_logs where created_at < now() - interval ?;
delete from session_logs where created_at < now() - interval ? and session_id not in (select id from active_sessions);
delete from sessions where expires_at < now();
insert into sessions (user_id, token, expires_at) values (42, ?, ?);

insert into monthly_reports (month, total_orders, total_revenue, avg_order_value) select date_trunc(?, created_at) as month, count(*) as total_orders, sum(total) as total_revenue, avg(total) as avg_order_value from orders where created_at >= date_trunc(?, current_date - interval ?) and created_at < date_trunc(?, current_date) group by month;

select p.name, p.category, count(distinct oi.order_id) as times_ordered, sum(oi.quantity) as total_quantity_sold, sum(oi.quantity * oi.price) as total_revenue from products p join order_items oi on p.id = oi.product_id join orders o on oi.order_id = o.id where o.created_at > now() - interval ? group by p.id, p.name, p.category having count(distinct oi.order_id) > 50 order by total_revenue desc;
select id, name, email from users where last_login > now() - interval ? order by last_login desc;

select date(o.created_at) as order_date, p.category, sum(oi.quantity * oi.price) as daily_revenue, count(distinct o.user_id) as unique_customers from orders o join order_items oi on o.id = oi.order_id join products p on oi.product_id = p.id where o.created_at > now() - interval ? group by order_date, p.category order by order_date desc, daily_revenue desc;
select * from orders where user_id = 42 order by created_at desc limit 10;
select date_trunc(?, created_at) as hour, count(*) as count, avg(total) as avg_total from orders where created_at > now() - interval ? group by hour order by hour;

select u.id, u.name, count(o.id) as order_count, sum(o.total) as total_spent from users u left join orders o on u.id = o.user_id where u.created_at > ? group by u.id, u.name order by total_spent desc limit 100;

select category, count(*) as total_products, avg(price) as avg_price, min(price) as min_price, max(price) as max_price, sum(stock) as total_stock from products where active = true group by category order by total_products desc;
select * from users where id = 42;
select category, subcategory, count(*) as product_count, avg(price) as avg_price from products where active = true group by category, subcategory order by category, product_count desc;
select product_id, count(*) as view_count, avg(duration) as avg_duration from product_views where timestamp > now() - interval ? group by product_id order by view_count desc;

select date_trunc(?, o.created_at) as day, p.category, count(distinct o.id) as order_count, sum(oi.quantity * oi.price) as revenue from orders o join order_items oi on o.id = oi.order_id join products p on oi.product_id = p.id where o.created_at > now() - interval ? group by day, p.category order by day desc, revenue desc;
select version();
update orders set status = ? where id = 1234;

update products set stock = stock - orders_temp.quantity from (select product_id, sum(quantity) as quantity from order_items where order_id in (select id from orders where status = ?)) as orders_temp where products.id = orders_temp.product_id;

update user_statistics set total_orders = sq.order_count, total_spent = sq.total_spent, last_order_date = sq.last_order, updated_at = now() from ( select user_id, count(*) as order_count, sum(total) as total_spent, max(created_at) as last_order from orders group by user_id ) sq where user_statistics.user_id = sq.user_id;
begin;

with cohort_data as ( select user_id, date_trunc(?, min(created_at)) as cohort_month, date_trunc(?, created_at) as order_month, count(*) as order_count from orders where created_at > now() - interval ? group by user_id, cohort_month, order_month ) select cohort_month, order_month, count(distinct user_id) as active_users, sum(order_count) as total_orders from cohort_data group by cohort_month, order_month order by cohort_month, order_month;

with daily_metrics as ( select date(created_at) as date, user_id, count(*) as daily_events, sum(duration) as daily_duration from user_events where created_at > now() - interval ? group by date, user_id ) select user_id, avg(daily_events) as avg_daily_events, avg(daily_duration) as avg_daily_duration, max(daily_events) as max_daily_events from daily_metrics group by user_id having avg(daily_events) > 10 order by avg_daily_events desc;

with user_segments as ( select user_id, case when total_orders > 100 then ? when total_orders > 10 then ? else ? end as segment from (select user_id, count(*) as total_orders from orders group by user_id) sq ) select segment, count(*) as user_count, avg(total_spent) as avg_spent from user_segments us join (select user_id, sum(total) as total_spent from orders group by user_id) os on us.user_id = os.user_id group by segment;
